item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #478 October 1, 2024
item.description:
Connections is a short daily word puzzle game that has players sorting words into mystery categories. In order to win this one, you will need to figure out which word goes in what place, and you have a limited number of tries to do it. Not only that, but there are no hints other than the words themselves.

Since the rules of Connections don't allow for in-game hints, this article is here to help. In the sections below, you can find everything you need to solve this challenging puzzle, including hints, spoilers, and even the full answer.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #478 for October 1, 2024

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Quick, Lather, Current, Conditioner, Rapid, Rinse, Health, Sweat, Normal, Wave, Form, Sanitize, Stew, Shape, Cascade, Tizzy.

What is the Definition of Tizzy?

A tizzy is a slang, English word for "a nervous, excited, or distracted state," according to Dictionary.com.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

There are several sections below, all containing different kinds of clues and spoilers for this mind-boggling puzzle game. Press the Read More button below the header of the item you want to see to reveal it.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle

Yellow NYT Connections Category Hints

Yellow Connections Category Answer

Yellow Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Green NYT Connections Category Hints

Green Connections Category Answer

Green Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Blue NYT Connections Category Hints

Blue Connections Category Answer

Blue Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Purple NYT Connections Category Hints

Purple Connections Category Answer

Purple Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Answers for Today's NYT Connections #478 for October 1, 2024

Still stuck and just want to see the whole answer for this New York Times Games puzzle game? In the section below, you will find all the words sorted into their proper categories and the categories themselves.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Connections website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom – Best Recipes For Cold Resistance
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Culinary skills in Tears of the Kingdom can help players fend off the cold.
  • Various recipes offer cold resistance, including Mushroom Risotto and Hylian Tomato Pizza.
  • Ingredients like Sunshrooms and Spicy Peppers can boost cold resistance in meals.

Tears of the Kingdom players may sometimes struggle to fend off the cold. There are many chilly regions in Hyrule, and without proper protection, players may frequently find themselves succumbing to the area's frosty bite. Cold-resistant clothing can be expensive, and it can initially be difficult to discover an alternative.

Luckily, players looking for a way to survive the cold in Tears of the Kingdom can cook up some of these delicious recipes that will provide them with ample cold resistance - enough to survive the coldest regions in the game. Here are some of the best recipes for cold resistance in Tears of the Kingdom .

Updated September 30, 2024 by Blaise Santi: There are more recipes in Tears of the Kingdom than most players will encounter during their playthroughs. However, for those who want the thrill of trying to make every recipe in the game, these additional recipes involve a little more complicated specifications of ingredients.

As a result, it can be tricky for players to figure out exactly how to turn these delectable meals into cold resistance-boosting boons. Follow the lists below to figure out how to make these tasty treats, and double-check to see if you already have the ingredients in your inventory to make these cold resistance recipes in Tears of the Kingdom without going searching for them.

1 Spicy Prime Cheesy Meat Bowl

Major Health Recovery, +1 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Raw Prime Meat

HP Recovery

Hylian Rice

HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

Hateno Cheese

HP Recovery Effect Duration Boost

Rock Salt

Effect Duration Boost

Spicy Pepper or Warm Safflina

Cold Resistance

The Prime Cheesy Meat Bowl certainly looks like one of the tastiest meals players can craft in Tears of the Kingdom , though it might be pretty tough to cook up. It requires Raw Prime Meat (or, for the Gourmet Cheesy Meat Bowl variant, Raw Gourmet Meat), Hylian Rice, Hateno Cheese, and Rock Salt, making it a pretty crowded recipe.

While its health bonuses are astounding, there's only room in the recipe for one additional ingredient to provide cold resistance, like a Spicy Pepper, though the handful of ingredients that boost effect duration will help make that power worth it.

2 Spicy Apple Pie

Minor Health Recovery, +1 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Apple

HP Recovery

Tabantha Wheat

HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

Cane Sugar

Effect Duration Boost

Goat Butter

Effect Duration Boost

Spicy Pepper

Cold Resistance

Everyone loves a good Apple Pie , especially players of Tears of the Kingdom . Apples are a necessary ingredient for this recipe, which is combined with Tabantha Wheat, Cane Sugar, and Goat Butter. Like the previous recipe, however, there's only room for one ingredient that boosts cold resistance.

However, given how plentiful apples are all across Hyrule, this makes for a good variety of the usual recipes they make up. Plus, some players might enjoy the thrill of making an Apple Pie to remind them of a favorite childhood delicacy.

3 Spicy Mushroom Risotto

Good Health Recovery, +2 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Sunshroom(s)

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery

Hylian Rice

HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

Goat Butter

Effect Duration Boost

Rock Salt

Effect Duration Boost

What's useful about the Mushroom Risotto for those looking for cold resistance recipes is that the recipe can utilize pretty much any variety of mushrooms. This means players can throw in up to two Sunshrooms for additional cold resistance, while the other ingredients include Hylian Rice, Goat Butter, and Rock Salt.

It's not as massive a health recovery option as other recipes available to cook in Tears of the Kingdom , but given the plethora of effect-duration-boosting ingredients included in the recipe, the cold resistance will be quite plentiful if players can gather two Sunshrooms for maximum cold resistance potential.

4 Spicy Herb Saute

Minor Health Recovery, +3 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Warm Safflina(s)

HP Recovery, Cold Resistance

Goron Spice

Effect Duration Boost

Among the simpler recipes on this list is the Herb Sauté , which surprisingly requires only two ingredients: a Warm Safflina and Goron Spice. For players with a plethora of Warm Safflinas to dispose of, this is a great recipe to use, as it can include up to four of the ingredient. Or, adversely, they can stock up on Goron Spices to increase its effect duration.

What might be an obstacle for some players is the rarity of these two ingredients. Goron Spice can only be purchased in two places: the Goron Gusto Shop in Goron City, and the Tabantha Bridge Stable. Warm Safflina, on the other hand, can be found growing out of the ground in the Gerudo Desert and Eldin Canyon, so stock up on heat resistance recipes!

5 Spicy Hylian Tomato Pizza

Major Health Recovery, +1 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Hylian Tomato

HP Recovery

Tabantha Wheat

HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

Hateno Cheese

HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

Spicy Pepper or Sunshroom

Cold Resistance

The Hylian Tomato Pizza is a brand-new recipe in Tears of the Kingdom , and it's one of the more challenging ones to make. For starters, Hateno Cheese can only be acquired after completing the side quest "A Letter to Koyin" in Hateno Village. Tabantha Wheat and Hylian Tomatos are also quite difficult to come by. But combining all three, and maybe some Rock Salt, will make a pizza.

Players can also add additional toppings, like Spicy Peppers, Sunshrooms, Warm Saffina, or Sizzlefin Trouts, to give their pizza cold resistance. The result will be a lot of health recovery along with their cold resistance meal, so it's best not to waste it by eating it in a non-freezing area.

6 Spicy Fruit And Mushroom Mix

Good Health Recovery, +1 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Any Fruit

Various Effects

Any Mushroom

Various Effects

Spicy Pepper or Sunshroom

Cold Resistance

The Fruit and Mushroom Mix is a fairly easy recipe to make in Tears of the Kingdom , as it's just any combination of fruit and mushrooms. To give it an extra kick, players can throw Spicy Peppers and Sunshrooms into the cooking pot. The result could be a bit of cold resistance, or a lot of it, depending on the ratio of regular fruit and shrooms to specialty ones.

When making the Spicy Fruit and Mushroom Mix, make sure that Link isn't combining these ingredients with other fruits or mushrooms with their own effects, like Chillshrooms or Stamina Bulbs. Rather than pile on, additional meal effects will cancel each other out. Instead, stick to cold resistance ingredients in each recipe.

7 Spicy Meaty Rice Balls

Full Health Recovery, +1 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Any Meat

HP Recovery

Hylian Rice

HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

Spicy Pepper or Sunshroom

Cold Resistance

To purchase Hylian Rice, look in Hateno Village, Zora's Domain, and Lookout Landing. It's easy to make many types of rice balls in Tears of the Kingdom , but with the right combination of gourmet or prime meat, players can benefit from full health recovery with this easy-to-make recipe. They'll also have room left over to throw in some Spicy Peppers or Sunshrooms.

Since the recipe only calls for one meat item and one Hylian Rice, players can add plenty of veggies and mushrooms with this recipe to get the most out of their cold resistance boost. Adding one or two extra Hylian Rice will also greatly increase the duration of their cold resistance boost. It's worth it if Link has enough ingredients to spare.

8 Spicy Prime/Gourmet Poultry Curry

Major Health Recovery, +1 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Any Bird Meat

HP Recovery

Hylian Rice

HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

Goron Spice

Effect Duration Boost

Spicy Pepper

Cold Resistance

There may be instances, especially late in Tears of the Kingdom , where players may find themselves with low health, and suffering from incremental health loss thanks to the cold. A great counter to this is Spicy Poultry Curry . Its Prime and Gourmet variations can be difficult to cook thanks to needing either Raw Bird Thighs, or even rarer, a Full Raw Bird.

Prime Poultry Curry will grant huge health recovery, which can be a rare combination to guarantee. Throw in a Spicy Pepper, and the result is a meal that will provide a long period of cold resistance in addition to its massive health restoration.

9 Spicy Cheesy Baked Fish

Major Health Recovery, +2 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Hateno Cheese

HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

Sizzlefin Trout

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

One of the best ways to acquire high-level cold resistance in Tears of the Kingdom is by using Sizzlefin Trouts. These fish provide a hefty boost to Link's cold resistance and can be used in a variety of recipes.

One recipe players can make with this fish is Cheesy Baked Fish . All they will need is one to four Sizzlefin Trouts and some Hateno Cheese. This will restore a nice amount of Hearts, and protect Link from the cold for over 10 minutes. It's important to note that Hateno Cheese can only be unlocked after the player has completed a certain quest line in Hateno Village.

10 Spicy Elixir

+1 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Warm Darner or Summerwing Butterfly

Cold Resistance

Monster Parts

Various Effects

Tears of the Kingdom players who find themselves short on cooking materials can instead use their excess monster parts to make a Spicy Elixir . For this recipe, players will need at least one Warm Darner or Summerwing Butterfly, and preferably a high-level monster part. The more valuable the monster part, the longer the cold resistance will last.

Players can purchase Warm Darners and Summerwing Butterflies from Beedle. They can be quite tricky to track down in the wild, so purchasing them straight from Beedle is the simplest way to acquire them. This recipe is best for players who aren't bothered about receiving any Hearts from a meal.

11 Spicy Seafood Rice Balls

Major Health Recovery, +2 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Hylian Rice

HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

Sizzlefin Trout

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

One of the simplest ways players can acquire cold resistance in Tears of the Kingdom is by cooking this variant of Seafood Rice Balls . This recipe only comprises two different ingredients: Sizzlefin Trouts, and Hylian Rice.

The player can use between one and four Sizzlefin Trouts. The more fish they use, the more cold resistance the dish will provide. Sizzlefin Trout can be found in warmer waters, such as the hot springs around Eldin. Hylian Rice can be bought from many vendors in Hyrule, including the one at Lookout Landing.

12 Spicy Tomato Seafood Soup

Major Health Recovery, +2 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Hylian Tomato

HP Recovery

Sizzlefin Trout

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

Tomato Seafood Soup is an incredibly simple recipe in Tears of the Kingdom, and the Spicy variant can help players looking to increase Link's cold resistance. All the player will need is a Hylian Tomato, and one to four Sizzlefin Trouts.

The more fish the player uses, the bigger the cold resistance bonus will be. Using all four trouts will grant a high-level cold resistance, making it possible for Link to traverse any cold environment without taking any weather damage. Sizzlefin Trout can easily be found in areas with warm water, including the hot springs in Hebra and Eldin.

13 Spicy Pepper Seafood

Major Health Recovery, +1 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Spicy Pepper

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery

Sizzlefin Trout

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

Tears of the Kingdom players who have some fish to spare can cook up some Spicy Pepper Seafood to help increase their cold resistance. This recipe can be made using any kind of fish and some Spicy Peppers.

It's recommended players use some of the more common fish they find, such as a Hyrule Bass, as the type of fish doesn't affect the cold-resistance effects. Fish can usually be found in any body of water and can be caught by swimming after them.

14 Spicy Pepper Steak

Major Health Recovery, +1 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Any Meat

HP Recovery

Spicy Pepper

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery

The Spicy Pepper Steak recipe can be prepared with any type of meat along with Spicy Peppers. When consumed, the Spicy Pepper Steak will grant the player some low-level Cold Resistance and some Heart recovery.

To acquire the meat for this recipe, players can hunt the various wild animals that roam the lands of Tears of the Kingdom . These animals will then serve as a source of meat, which can be used in this recipe. Spicy Peppers can be found throughout Hyrule but are most common in the Gerudo Desert and Hyrule Field.

15 Spicy Veggie Rice Balls

Minor Health Recovery, +1 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Hylian Rice

HP Recovery, Effect Duration Boost

Spicy Pepper

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery

Cooking some Spicy Veggie Rice Balls in Tears of the Kingdom is pretty simple. Players will need to make sure they have between one and four Warm Safflina plants and some Hylian Rice. The longer players want their cold resistance to last, the more Warm Safflinas they should add to the recipe.

Warm Safflina commonly grows in warmer climates, so players should check out Gerudo Canyon and Desert if they're running low. Conveniently, Hylian Rice can be purchased from a lot of the merchants in Hyrule, or alternatively, players might be able to find some whilst cutting some grass.

16 Spicy Tomato Mushroom Stew

Major Health Recovery, +2 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Hylian Tomato

HP Recovery

Sunshrooms

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery

Players might find that they have an abundance of Hylian Tomatoes. Luckily, they can use some of them with this recipe. To make some Spicy Tomato Mushroom Stew , players will need a Hylian Tomato and between one and four Sunshrooms. This recipe will provide players with high-level cold resistance for ten and a half minutes.

For players who have yet to come across some Hylian Tomatoes, they can luckily find them throughout Hyrule. Most commonly, however, they can be found in East and West Necluda, often growing near tree trunks.

17 Spicy Fragrant Mushroom Saute

Minor Health Recovery, +2 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Goron Spice

Effect Duration Boost

Sunshrooms

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery

Players looking for a way to survive the cold in Tears of the Kingdom and gain some high-level cold resistance should prepare some Spicy Fragrant Mushroom Sauté . For this recipe, players will need to have between one and four Sunshrooms and some Goron Spice.

Goron Spice can be obtained conveniently from the General Store in Goron City. Sunshrooms, meanwhile, can be found in some of the warmer areas of Hyrule, such as the Gerudo Desert and Eldin Canyon.

18 Spicy Sauteed Peppers

Good Health Recovery, +1 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Spicy Peppers

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery

The recipe for Spicy Sautéed Peppers is incredibly simple and is probably one of the first recipes players will make. The recipe only requires a single ingredient: Spicy Peppers. These peppers are easily found all over Hyrule, and each of their plants typically yields three Spicy Peppers.

To make Spicy Sauteed Peppers, players should add as many Spicy Peppers as they can to a bowl - the number of peppers added determines the duration of cold resistance granted, with a higher number of peppers resulting in a longer duration. This recipe, in particular, is great for helping players reach the snowy shrine on Great Sky Island without freezing.

19 Spicy Steamed Mushrooms

Minor Health Recovery, +2 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Sunshrooms

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery

Any Vegetable

Various Effects

Players looking for one of the best recipes for cold resistance in Tears of the Kingdom are in the right place. The Spicy Steamed Mushrooms recipe will grant players some high-level cold resistance that will last long enough to get a good bit of adventuring done. This recipe is particularly useful for players who are struggling to get to some of the colder areas in the game, such as Rito Village and Mount Lanayru, without freezing.

For this recipe, players will need to make sure they have up to four Sunshrooms and some Warm Safflina. Warm Safflina can commonly be found in warmer regions, such as the Gerudo Desert, along with Sunshrooms, which can also be found in the Eldin Canyon.

20 Spicy Mushroom Skewer

Good Health Recovery, +2 Cold Resistance

Ingredients

Effects

Sunshrooms

Cold Resistance, HP Recovery

One of the best cold-resisting recipes that players can cook in Tears of the Kingdom is the Spicy Mushroom Skewer . Players will need to gather up to five Sunshrooms for this recipe.

Players should be able to locate Sunshrooms in some of the areas with a warmer climate, such as Eldin Canyon and the Gerudo Highlands. Once they have gathered their ingredients and cooked them up, they will have a dish that provides them with high-level cold resistance, protecting them from even some of the coldest regions in Hyrule.

item.title: 5 Strongest Versions Of The Space Marines In Warhammer 40k Games
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Terminators are elite, heavily armored Marines with powerful weapons and teleportation technology in Space Hulk.
  • Grey Knights, psyker-powered Marines, were created to combat Chaos and are one of the strongest warriors in the Warhammer universe.
  • Lieutenant Titus receives a significant upgrade to Primaris Space Marine in Space Marine 2, granting superior strength and power.

The Space Marines are an elite superhuman faction of the Warhammer 40k franchise and arguably the most well-known warriors in the series. Genetically modified and put through the most rigorous tests in the Imperium, the Space Marines are humanity's greatest defenders, fighting to protect the Imperium from the threats of Chaos and the evil that lurks in the galaxy.

The Space Marines can be divided into various legions, such as the Space Wolves and the famed Ultramarines. Although these legions initially fought for the same cause, they remain largely fractured due to various legions' betrayal of the Emperor in the name of Chaos. Throughout the Warhammer franchise, players can play as different variations of Space Marines, each with their own strong suit.

5 Terminator

Space Hulk: Deathwing

  • Platforms : PlayStation 4, PC
  • Released : December 14, 2016
  • Developers : Streum On Studio
  • Genre : First-Person Shooter, RPG

If anyone thinks standard Space Marines are tough, Terminators take their power to a new level; they are veteran Space Marines wearing tank-like armor. Terminator armor combines the power armor of traditional Space Marines with other advancements, such as teleportation technology and powerful heavy weapons. Players in Space Hulk: Deathwing , a video game version of the board game Space Hulk, can play as Terminators. In the game, players engage in tactical gameplay, employing Terminators in combat online and in the game's campaign.

Space Hulk also has extensive customization options, enabling players to create their favorite legions, such as Blood Angels. Terminators play an essential part in Deathwing and are one of the strongest versions of Space Marines in video games.

4 Grey Knights

Warhammer 40,000: Chaos Gate — Daemonhunters

The Imperium's greatest weapon, the Grey Knights , was created by the Emperor of Mankind after the events of the Horus Heracy. A secretive but elite legion of Space Marines, the Grey Knights were specifically made to face down the armies of Chaos.

These Space Marines have unique psyker abilities and expert combat proficiency, wielding powerful weapons to defeat their enemies. Although the Grey Knights do not have a Primaris version, they are still incredibly powerful. They are one of the strongest warriors in the Warhammer 40k universe, specially assigned to defeat the most evil warriors.

Warhammer 40,000: Chaos Gate - Daemonhunters features Grey Knights in all their glory, with players controlling the Space Marines in tactical RPG gameplay to fight the forces of god Nurgle and stop a plague from consuming the galaxy.

3 Primaris Ultramarine

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

In Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 , players pick back up with the series' protagonist, Lieutenant Titus, as he fights the evil forces of the Warhammer 40k universe. This version of Titus has been demoted from the rank of captain due to suspected heretical Ultramarines in his chapter and tortured for the truth.

In the first Space Marine game, Titus is a mere firstborn marine, smaller in size and far less powerful than he appears in the sequel. In Space Marine 2 , Titus dons the new Primaris Space Marine armor, which grants him a couple of extra feet in height, vastly superior strength, and better dexterity in the face of danger.

Instructed for creation by Ultramarine Primarch Roboute Guilliman, the Primaris Ultramarines are superior warriors in every way, defending the Imperium against the forces of Chaos and other evils. Lieutenant Titus gets this significant upgrade in Space Marine 2 , with notable enhancements in the power that players can wield.

2 Victrix Guard

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

The Victrix Guard are elite Ultramarines accompanying Chapter Master Lord Calgar in Space Marine 2 — aiding Lieutenant Titus in fighting hordes of Chaos. Appearing in an epic cutscene that sees the Guard and Calgar decimate numerous Chaos warriors, this elite Ultramarine force is chosen directly by Primarch Roboute Guilliman. Victrix Guards have martial prowess over other Ultramarines and an undying loyalty to their leaders, such as Calgar, protecting them at all costs.

The Guard wield Storm Shields and Gladius swords to slay enemies, and they are one of the most powerful versions of Space Marines portrayed in the Warhammer 40k games.

1 Lord Calgar

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

The Chapter Master of the Ultramarines and a decorated warrior of mankind, Lord Calgar , known as Marneus Calgar , appears alongside his Victrix Guard in Space Marine 2 . Lord Calgar is the first firstborn Ultramarine and one of the first Ultramarines to get a Primaris upgrade.

A strategic genius and extremely powerful warrior, Calgar leads his legion from the front lines in service to the Emperor. The Chapter Master's list of accomplishments is lengthy, from stopping a Daemon Prince to defeating some of the strongest enemies in single combat. A proud warrior and, undoubtedly, the strongest Space Marine in Warhammer 40k video games, Marneus Calgar, is at the top of the Space Marine food chain, second only to the Primarchs.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for September 30, 2024
item.description:
Strands has yet another difficult word-find puzzle game for today. This one is uniquely challenging if you don't know much about the subject, and it's a subject that many fans might be unfamiliar with.

In order to win, you'll need more than just a hint or two. If you don't like the hints the rules of Strands allows for, then check out the article below. It contains hints, spoilers, and other things to help you on your way.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #211 September 30, 2024

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue Words with Weight. There are eight things to find, including the Spangram and the seven themed words.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

In the sections below, you will find hints to get you closer to the theme for today. Open them up to get a clue without ruining any of the themed words in this minimalist puzzle game.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

If a spoiler or two would help with this challenging puzzle game, you can find them below. Each section has just one spoiled word inside along with a screenshot of where that word goes in the puzzle's grid.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

The complete answer to the New York Times Strands is in the section below. If you open it up, you will see all the themed words, the Spangram, and a screenshot of a completed puzzle to help you solve yours.

Today's Strands Explained

If you don't get today's puzzle, check out the section below. Inside is an explanation for how the Spangram and the themed words go together and what the clue means.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #477 September 30, 2024
item.description:
Connections is back with another challenging puzzle to start your day. In these sixteen words, there are some difficult words and even more difficult groupings. If you are stuck on this one, you are not alone.

If you already know how to play Connections and just need a hand with this one, this article contains everything you need to know. Scroll down to see all sorts of helpful tips, answers, and everything in between.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #477 for September 30, 2024

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Dorothy, Roam, Rose, Steam, Vanilla, Sophia, Shaggy, Blanch, Charlie, Boil, Keto, Musk, Ambergris, Wallace, Soul, Poach.

What is the Definition of Ambergris?

Ambergris is a waxy buildup that is found inside the stomachs of whales. It is a common ingredient in perfumes and other cosmetics.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

If you are looking for a hint or two for this puzzle game, you can find tons of them below. Look inside the sections to see everything from spoilers to general clues.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle

Yellow NYT Connections Category Hints

Yellow Connections Category Answer

Yellow Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Green NYT Connections Category Hints

Green Connections Category Answer

Green Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Blue NYT Connections Category Hints

Blue Connections Category Answer

Blue Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Purple NYT Connections Category Hints

Purple Connections Category Answer

Purple Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Answers for Today's NYT Connections #477 for September 30, 2024

Searching for the full spoiler for this minimalist puzzle game? You can find it in the expandable section below. Open it up to take a peek at all four categories and the words that go in each one.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Connections website available on almost any device with a browser.
